pr_title: Update compiledLambdaMap in RowExpressionCompiler for SQL functions

timeline.message:
Update compiledLambdaMap in RowExpressionCompiler for SQL functions

With the introduction of SQL function, we might find new lambdas while processing SQL functions.
Since we are adding the compiled lambda function to the same class as the expression containing lambda,
we need to update the compiledLambdaMap to make sure it always has all the previous compiled lambdas
and do not try to create the same method again.

timeline.bodyText: nit: what about something like alreadyCompiledLambdas ?
timeline.author: wenleix
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -101,6 +102,19 @@ private LambdaBytecodeGenerator()
         return generateMethodsForLambda(containerClassDefinition, callSiteBinder, cachedInstanceBinder, ImmutableList.of(expression), metadata, sqlFunctionProperties, methodNamePrefix);
     }
 
+    public static Map<LambdaDefinitionExpression, CompiledLambda> generateMethodsForLambda(
+            ClassDefinition containerClassDefinition,
+            CallSiteBinder callSiteBinder,
+            CachedInstanceBinder cachedInstanceBinder,
+            RowExpression expression,
+            Metadata metadata,
+            SqlFunctionProperties sqlFunctionProperties,
+            String methodNamePrefix,
+            Set<LambdaDefinitionExpression> compiledLambdas)

replies.bodyText: Renamed to existingCompiledLambdas. "Compiled" kinda implied "already" so it's a little weird.
replies.author: rongrong
